newsitem.title: UK: IPE Brent closes weak, eyes on NYMEX crude.
newsitem.headline: IPE Brent closes weak, eyes on NYMEX crude.

text.p: IPE Brent crude oil futures ended the day weaker after a session of thin trading and traders said February NYMEX crude's failure to fall below the key level of $26.00 a barrel had prevented a large further slippage.
February Brent closed 21 cents a barrel down on the day at $24.36. February gas oil earlier ended its session $4.50 down at $226.25 a tonne.
"All eyes were on WTI (NYMEX crude,)" one broker said. "If we had fallen through $26.00 then it could have fallen quite quickly.
NYMEX February crude stood at $26.08 at 2019 GMT after earlier touching $26.00.
Traders said that a perception that the recent cold snap had not eaten into European oil stocks as much as had been earlier expected had contributed to gas oil's weakness.
January gas oil expired at midday with a delivery requirement of 261,700 tonnes.
Dealers said that warmer weather forecast for Europe had largely been factored into prices and the energy complex was weaker more as a result of technical factors than anything else.
"The weather is looking warmer but that has really been priced in to the market," an IPE floor dealer said.
